Posts.Content: Jun 7, 2008 10:04PM cgraham wrote: I brought mom home from the hospital today.  She did wonderful.  Our prayers were answered and she breezed through the surgery.  Now we just have to wait to see what her treatment will be.  She did have some confusion in the hospital but most of the hospital staff were very understanding.  They were amazed at how well she did meanly because she had never been in the hospital before except to have children.  I purchased a surgical cami for her and it is working out very well.  That was the best tip yet.  I am so happy that I found this web sight.  It is comforting to have a place to go to get great information and support. :) C

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2008 12:49PM cgraham wrote: Mom got through her surgery just great.  Her dementia is a bit worse from the surgery.  Because of the Alzhiemer's it is hard for her to follow the Dr's orders for her post care.  She is stubborn anyway but she thinks that she can just do whatever she wants.  It was nearly 100 degrees here yesterday and she was going to walk to the store. The good news is the surgeon feels that he got all of the cancer!  We will see the oncologist tomorrow but the surgeon feels that she won't need any further treatment. I am thankful for that. cgraham

Posts.Content: May 30, 2008 09:33PM cgraham wrote: My mother's preop was today.  She does very well with her Alzhiemer's disease when she keeps her routine but she can't answer questions so at the preop I answered her questions for her but she argured with me about everyone.  She is at a difficult state in her disease. She is clinging to her independence but I am realizing that she probably shouldn't be alone.  To add to the difficulty she has no money and is state dependent. When she has her surgery I will be there 24/7.  She hides her memory loss very well. She just wants the cancer out of her.  She doesn't want treatment or any recontructive surgery.  The Dr said that all she would have is radiation if necessary and no recontruction. C
